task.title: Create a New Knowledge Base Article
task.shortdesc: Follow these steps to create a new Knowledge Base article and change the ownership to the appropriate Group.

step.info: For guidance, visit Navigate to the Knowledge Base.

step.cmd: Verify your intended new article is not already covered in the Knowledge Base.
step.info: For guidance, visit Search for Duplicate Articles for guidance.

step.cmd: If there is no duplicate article, click +New Article.

info.i: The New Article form will appear.

step.info: See TDX Knowledge: Assign a Category/Subcategory to the Knowledge Article.

image.alt: A screenshot of the Knowledge Base Category Lookup.

step.info: Click the Lookup Category icon to do a search of categories.
DO NOT change the Order field.
DO NOT click the Pin Article checkbox.

step.cmd: Enter article content in the Body field.
step.info: Visit Enter Body Field Article Content for guidance
DO NOT include the title for the article in the Body field.
Do include a summary to provide context for what follows. This can be a single sentence.
Format the article as needed following our standards. Visit Format for Internal and Public-Facing Articles for guidance.
Use under 100 characters if possible
Visit List of Article Types for reference.
Tags allow users to search for the aritcle by keywords.
Enter a tag for the technology referred to in the article. For example, "Canvas", "Salesforce".
New tag names may only contain alpha-numeric characters or hyphens with no spaces.
You can enter any number of tags.

step.info: Use this field to enter any information a technician might need to support a customer when the article is published to it.umn.edu.

step.cmd: Select the appropriate response to the prompt "Should the viewing of this content be limited to the University community?"

image.alt: A screenshot of the View Mode.

cmd.i: Global Editors, change the Owner from yourself to the appropriate Group.

step.cmd: Change the Owner to the appropriate Group if needed.
step.info: If you are a Group Knowledge Editor or a technician, and you change an article to a group you are not a member of, you will no longer be able to edit the article after changing the Owner.
Everyone in the Group will be able to edit Not Submitted articles owned by the Group.
Group Editors will be able to edit, approve or reject, and archive all articles owned by the Group.
